# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(str, " ")
        if length(word) > text_width
            throw(ArgumentError("Word '$word' exceeds maximum line width of $text_width characters."))
        end
        push!(lines, word)
        if length(join(lines, " ")) >= text_width
            push!(lines, "") # Add an empty line to start a new paragraph
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
str = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines. The maximum line width should be 10 characters per line."
println(wrap_string(str))
```
